citation.article-title: Planotetraspora thailandica sp. nov., isolated from soil in Thailand.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Planotetraspora thailandica sp. nov.
Planotetraspora thailandica (thai.lan′di.ca. N.L. fem. adj. thailandica of Thailand, where the type strain was isolated).
Gram-positive-staining, mesophilic, non-motile actinomycete that forms well-developed and branched substrate hyphae.
Colonies are pale yellow on ISP medium no. 2.
Cylindrical sporangia containing four oval- to rod-shaped spores are formed at the ends of short sporangiospores on the aerial mycelium.
Spores are non-motile.
No soluble pigment is detected in ISP media 2, 3, 4 and 5.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Utilizes cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-lactose, d-mannitol, d-melibiose, d-raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-xylose, glycerol and salicin, but not l-arabinose or d-ribose.
Acid is produced from d-glucose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melibiose, l-rhamnose and d-xylose, but not d-galactose, d-lactose, maltose or d-raffinose.
Peptonization of milk, hydrolysis of starch and gelatin liquefaction are negative.
Optimal temperature for growth is 25–30 °C.
No growth occurs above 37 °C.
The maximum NaCl concentration for growth is 1 %.
Cell wall contains glutamic acid, alanine and meso-A2pm.
These amino acids correspond to murein type A1γ.
The predominant menaquinones are MK-9(H4), MK-9(H8) and MK-9(H2).
The characteristic whole-cell sugars are rhamnose, madurose, glucose, galactose and 3-O-methylmannose.
The diagnostic phospholipid is phosphatidylethanolamine; phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylcholine and glucosamine-containing phospholipids are not detected.
The major fatty acids of the type strain are iso-C16 : 0, 10-methylated C17 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, C15 : 0, 10-methylated C16 : 0, C16 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0, C17 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0 and C17 : 1.
The G+C content of the DNA is 71.1 mol%.
The type strain is BCC 21825T (=NBRC 104271T), isolated from soil in Thailand.
